DictionaryEntry.definition: use words or spoken language to convey information or have a conversation
to fight against in order to try and win against an opponent
a burning that is of a controlled nature and can be used to heat objects; can also produce light
a plant that is typically tall with bark, a trunk, leaves, and branches
to cause an object to move around an axis.
to exert a force upon an object. Can be used on objects such as buttons or can be used for moving an object to an adjacent space (when possible).

DictionaryEntry.wordEnglish: to open; to unwrap; to unlock
DictionaryEntry.definition: to open or unlock an object. Can be used on objects such as doors or chests (when possible)
to close or shut an object. Can be used on objects such as doors or windows (when possible).

DictionaryEntry.wordEnglish: to exist (inanimate objects); to be (inanimate objects)
DictionaryEntry.definition: the act of existing or being in existence for inanimate objects. Examples include plants and tables.

DictionaryEntry.wordEnglish: to exist (animate objects); to be (animate objects)
DictionaryEntry.definition: the act of existing or being in existence for living and breathing beings or animate objects. Examples include people and animals.

DictionaryEntry.wordEnglish: to not exist (inanimate objects); to not be (inanimate objects)
DictionaryEntry.definition: the act of not existing or not being in existence for inanimate objects. Examples include plants and tables.

DictionaryEntry.wordEnglish: to not exist (animate objects); to not be (animate objects)
DictionaryEntry.definition: the act of not existing or not being in existence for living and breathing beings or animate objects. Examples include people and animals.
